name: Napa Valley Marriott Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights on business so I didn't read the reviews before I went. The hotel is not in a location you would consider for a romantic getaway since it's across the street from a strip mall with Target, etc. and is not in the cute part of Napa. However, the room seemed fine at first. Then I realized I was stolen from too, as a previous reviewer noted. I am now down two ipods and a Palm Pilot. I understand that hotels do not have liability for this, but really, I've never had anything stolen from me in over 8 years of traveling for business. I had a strange feeling when I got in my car to leave that I was missing some things but drove away. I called when I was less than an hour away and alerted the hotel of my missing belongings and they tried to tell me maybe I had left it in the restaurant which I never visited. The only conclusion I can draw is they were stolen either during a cleaning or once I called to say they were missing. I will never stay here again and will tell all my friends and coworkers not to as well.
reviews.title: Beware the Napa Marriott

reviews.text: My brother's girlfriend works for Marriott and because of her we decided to check out the Marriott properties while spending a week in the Napa and Sonoma areas.
reviews.title: Napa Napa Napa

reviews.title: Be cautious!

reviews.text: After reading the past reviews, I have decided that all the complaining about construction must have resulted in an entirely new Marriot resort :)
reviews.title: Great Value..Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed at hotel for two nights Oct. 30th and 31st, and enjoyed my stay. The hotel has been remodeled since my last stay (three years ago), and has upgraded bedding (very comfortable bed, with down comforter) and decor. The location is perfect, and the service was very good. There are probably a few better hotels in the area, but for the price and the points, I would recommend the Napa Marriott.
reviews.title: Better than last visit

likes.liked: — Comfortable rooms and hotel was in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is everything you would expect from a low end Marriott - adequate rooms, noise from the freeway, overpriced resturant, and fair service.
reviews.title: Nothing to write home about

likes.disliked: — Inability to get timely respone from hotel staff

reviews.text: The biggest issue I have with this, or any other Marriott, is the execssive rate charged for internet access. $9.95 per DAY for in room and up to $30.00 per HOUR in the business center.
reviews.title: Loved the Napa Marriott

reviews.title: Great experience

likes.liked: — Beds, decoration, baths, free parking, free coffee

reviews.title: Nice facilities but,...
reviews.text: I am beginning to wonder when Marriott will begin charging for the "complementary" shampoo, conditioner, etc as well as a per towel charge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so impressed with this hotel. Outstanding service, one of the most comfortable beds we ever slept in, and great food and wine tasting. We stayed in the Concierge wing and would highly recommend it. The location is convenient to downtown Napa (we ate at Chop's Steakhouse one night and it was very good) as well as heading north to the many vineyards (such beautiful scenery). Would also recommend a meal at the Culinary Institute (Greystone). So much wine, so little time.
reviews.title: Absolutely Great Place

likes.liked: — Everything that came with the Concierge Wing room - comfortable bed, food, wine, services
likes.disliked: — Couldn't get calls on phone which needed phone vendor to fix

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel due to a great Priceline deal. I was a little bit hesitant, but decided it couldn't be that bad. On the trip with me was my husband and 9 month old. Overall, the experience was quite good. Upon arrival, we saw that the lobby is pretty standard for a 3 star hotel. We had requested a crib, which was in the room when we got there. The parking was free and right outside our door, which is great when you have so many bags to bring in because of a baby. We weren't expecting too much, since we got such a great rate. I would not want to spend over $200 for the normal rate for this hotel however. It is a standard 3 star hotel, very clean, great bath amenities. It did the job for us and we were quite happy. I would definitely return provided we get another discounted rate.
reviews.title: Not fancy, but decent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the hotel on my anniversery and when I was checking in they informed us that I didnt have a resvervation on a Saturday night. After the staff researched they found out that it was my travel agent who had booked us at another Marriott in the area. The staff was amazing they were able to get us a beautiful room and called and canceled the original reservation without a charge. The Front desk helped book our Spa treatments at the spa on property which was amazing and the concierge planned out entire stay from which winerys to visit and dinner reservation at Mustards Grill on a Sat night. When we returned from dinner we had champagne and chocalate dipped strawberries in our room with a note from the staff wishing us a happy anniversery. What started out bad turned into one of the best experiences we have ever had at a hotel. Thanks to the staff and the service they provided.
reviews.title: Loved the service
Very Comfortable
reviews.text: We had a very nice room at this hotel and the bed was extremely comfortable. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to all our friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A previous reviewer was right when comparing this hotel to a Motel 6. It is the old 2 story motel style, right on highway 29 and in no way a classic reliable Marriott. The rooms appear to be part way through a make-over with green stripe drapes, red bedspreads and circa 1970 furniture. Nothing and I mean nothing matches. That wouldn't be so bad if it were clean but alas that is not the case.
reviews.title: Down on the heals Marriott

aka: Napa Valley Marriott Hotel And Spa
description: Experience the charm and beauty of Napa California’s world-famous wine country from the area’s premier hotel – the Napa Valley Marriott Hotel & Spa. Providing exceptional hotel room accommodations for business travel, meetings, and perfectly located for leisurely exploring, our Napa hotel is surrounded with opportunities to treat yourself in every sense. Conveniently located in the heart of California’s renowned Napa Wine Country, just off Highway 29, our hotel offers the ideal setting.
